docs.lead_paragraph: President Bush vowed tonight that he would not burden future generations with the nation's pressing domestic problems: growing budget deficits, a lagging economy and a crisis in health care. He offered few new specifics on how he would solve those problems, and Democrats asserted that some of his proposals could actually worsen them. But Mr. Bush, addressing one of the core critiques of his administration, argued that he ''will not pass along our problems to other Congresses, other presidents and other generations.''

headline.main: President Vows Steps to Handle Domestic Woes
headline.kicker: STATE OF THE UNION: DOMESTIC AGENDA

byline.original: By ROBIN TONER and ROBERT PEAR
